channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: My father is giving me $250K to buy a home, but told me not to tell my two siblings. Am I morally obligated to tell them?
item.description: “I don’t want to jeopardize my father’s kind offer.”

item.title: My boyfriend owns a house and earns more than me, but I refuse to marry him without a prenup. Is that wise?
item.description: “I recently learned about land that has been in my family for 150 years.”

item.title: Stellantis and Mercedes-Benz withdraw guidance as VW says it can’t quantify tariff hit

item.title: Former ‘19 Kids and Counting’ star Jim Bob Duggar buys $1 milllion Arkansas property
item.description: Did the father of 19 buy the house for his daughter-in-law, whose husband is in prison?

item.title: Kiss rocker Gene Simmons lists $14 million Beverly Hills mansion—with a strict buyer selection process
item.description: Simmons is excluding potential buyers he believes will soil the happy memories he and his family have made in the home.

item.title: xMEMS extends micro cooling fan-on-a-chip tech to AI data centers
item.description: xMEMS Labs, a pioneer of MEMS-based chips, announced that its innovative µCooling fan-on-a-chip tech will be expanded to AI data centers.

item.title: No more window switching: Mastercard’s Agent Pay transforms how enterprises use AI search
item.description: Mastercard is working with AI companies and banks to allow AI platforms and agents to facilitate transactions.

item.description: Tripp launched Kōkua AI, a mental wellness guide designed to deliver real-time, personalized emotional support across multiple platforms.
